alert.note: Alert for Camden; Pasquotank; Perquimans (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pasquotank, central Camden and central Perquimans Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Nixonton, or near Weeksville, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Pasquotank, central Camden and central Perquimans Counties, including the following locations... Bob White Fork, Pasquotank, Jacocks, Rabbit Corner, Frog Island, Stevenson Point, Symonds Creek, Listers Corner, Parkville and Woodville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
